Class NullAnalysisHelper

java.lang.Object
net.sf.jstuff.core.validation.NullAnalysisHelper
@NonNullByDefault({}) public abstract class NullAnalysisHelper extends Object

  • Method Details

    • asNonNull

      public static <T> @NonNull T asNonNull(@Nullable T value)
      Casts a non-null value marked as Nullable to NonNull.

      Only use if you are sure the value is non-null but annotation-based null analysis was not able to determine it.

      This method is not meant for non-null input validation.

      Returns:
      the input value cast to NonNull
      Throws:
      IllegalStateException - if the given value is null

    • asNonNull

      public static <T> @NonNull T asNonNull(@Nullable T value, String errorMessage)
      Casts a non-null value marked as Nullable to NonNull.

      Only use if you are sure the value is non-null but annotation-based null analysis was not able to determine it.

      This method is not meant for non-null input validation.

      Returns:
      the input value cast to NonNull
      Throws:
      IllegalStateException - with the given errorMessage if the given value is null

    • asNonNull

      @SafeVarargs public static <T> @NonNull T @NonNull [] asNonNull(T @Nullable ... value)
      Casts an array with non-null elements as Nullable to NonNull.

      Only use if you are sure the value is non-null but annotation-based null analysis was not able to determine it.

      This method is not meant for non-null input validation.

      Returns:
      the input value cast to NonNull
      Throws:
      IllegalStateException - if the given value is null or contains nulls

    • asNonNullUnsafe

      public static <T> @NonNull T asNonNullUnsafe(T value)
      Casts the given value to NonNull without any validation.

      Only use if you are sure the value is non-null but annotation-based null analysis was not able to determine it.

      Returns:
      the input value cast to NonNull

    • asNonNullUnsafe

      @SafeVarargs public static <T> @NonNull T @NonNull [] asNonNullUnsafe(T... value)
      Casts the elements of given array to NonNull without any validation.

      Only use if you are sure the value is non-null but annotation-based null analysis was not able to determine it.

      Returns:
      the input array cast to NonNull

    • asNullable

      public static <T> @Nullable T asNullable(T value)
      Casts the given non-null value as Nullable.
      Returns:
      the input value cast to Nullable

    • asNullableElements

      @SafeVarargs public static <T> @Nullable T[] asNullableElements(T... value)
      Casts the elements of the given array as Nullable.
      Returns:
      the input array cast to Nullable

    • defaultIfNull

      public static <T> @NonNull T defaultIfNull(@Nullable T object, @NonNull T defaultValue)

    • lateNonNull

      public static <T> @NonNull T lateNonNull()
      Allows the temporary assignment of null to a @NonNull field during declaration, deferring proper initialization until a later point when the actual non-null value is available.

      This method is useful when a field must be initialized later but cannot be left unassigned at the point of declaration (e.g. when a value is provided by a later setup step).

      Note: The field must be assigned a non-null value before it is accessed to prevent NullPointerExceptions.

      This method is functionally identical to sneakyNull(), but it is named differently to clarify its intended use for deferred field initialization.

    • sneakyNull

      public static <T> @NonNull T sneakyNull()
      Returns null while pretending to be a @NonNull value. This can be used to pass null values to methods or fields that enforce non-null constraints, bypassing the compiler's non-null checks.

      Note: This method intentionally breaks the @NonNull contract. Ensure that the receiving code can safely handle a null value to avoid NullPointerExceptions.
